result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald W Coulthurst was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

*Pay costs

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
*Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1 of 16CF21

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donald W Coulthurst in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Donald W Coulthurst in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CM488 and 16CF21.

8:50 a.m.  Atty Cousins calls the case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM488:
Count 1 - No contest 

16CF21:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 16CF21 and Count 2 is DRI and guilty on Count 1 of 15CM488.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with victim notification.
No request for restitution on either file.
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CM488:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay a 9 month jail sentence - consecutive to 16CF21
Placed on Probation for 12 months - concurrent to 16CF21
**Conditions of Probation -
Comply with the conditions as stated in Count 1 of 16CF21
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

16CF21:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 5 year prison sentence
3 years of initial confinement
2 years of extended supervision
Placed on Probation for 24 months - concurrent to 15CM488
**Conditions of Probation -
No contact either direct or indirect with Theresa King, her residence or her family members 
No contact either direct or indirect with Tiffany Meyer, her residence or her family members
Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.
Pay costs
Pay Surcharges 

Count 2 - DRI
Plea/Sentencing set for May 8, 2017 at 8:30 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 8, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 27, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Pre-Trial Conference set for 11/28/16 - attempted, not known
Pre-trial conference on November 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Pre-Trial Conference set for 10/10/16 - insufficient address
/s/ RJS
Pre-trial conference on October 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held on 06-10-16
Pre-Trial Conference set for 08/08/16 - attempted, not known
/s/ RJS
Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Donald W Coulthurst in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Donald W Coulthurst in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF325 (sentencing after revocation), 16CF21 (status) & 15CM488 (status).

10:02 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Atty Cousins states that the revocation is on the 15CF325 case only and makes further statements.
The other 2 cases listed are set for status today and will not be heard at today's sentencing after revocation.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the Revocation packet(s) and Warrant
Atty Cousins has no changes or corrections to the revocation packet.
Atty McFarland has a change/correction to the revocation packet - change would be to "attempted battery".  This is the only correction of Atty McFarland.
Assistant DA argues regarding sentencing
.
Attorney for the defendant argues regarding sentencing
.
Defendant makes a statement prior to his sentencing on revocation.

BY THE COURT:
15CF325:
Count 1 -
Ordered to 28 months initial confinement and 28 months extended supervision.
Jail credit of 234 days.
**Conditions of Extended Supervision (reimpose conditions at initial sentencing):
No contact with victims, or businesses:   John Dollan, Roy Sckrzeczkoski, Coffee Studio, Bumper to Bumper, Len Dudas Motors, A to Z Auto. 
Complete a Mental Health or Psychological evaluation and comply with recommendations.   
Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent. 
Pay costs 
Pay restitution or $149.10.
Complete a mental health assessment and comply with recommendations.
Take all medications as prescribed.
Complete ongoing behavioral treatment or phychiatric treatment if documented by the mental health assessment and comply with recommendations.
Do not possess firearms or dangerous weapons.
Unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

Count 4 -
9 months jail concurrent to Count 1 & 6
Count 6 -
9 months jail concurrent to Count 1 & 4

Defendant is informed of appeal rights.
/s/ RJS
Status conference on June 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-Trial Conference set for 04/25/16 - attempted, not known
Pre-trial conference on April 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.
